originalText.text: PA'LANTE goes the extra mile where other housing nonprofits don't. On top of getting legal services for tenants (where not a single tenant has been evicted), they help organize the tenants into a tenants association, move elected officials to fight for dignified and affordable housing, do weekly food giveaways, and so much more. In my experience, every person I have referred to PA'LANTE has been nothing short of satisfied with the level of care, service, and support they receive.

originalText.text:
Left high and dry.
My slumlord is taking me to court so I contacted Palante because they were helping someone else in our building. I met with Elsia Vásquez in August. She had me do some investigating (rent history, lease, ect), found out there was a warrant issued, and was very helpful. After my first court date (Sep) - which was suspended and presponed to Nov, I contacted Elsia so we could continue the process. She wasn't available, she contacted me while I was at work and left a voice mail telling me to contact her back. I kept calling and she was never available. Was told to stop calling that she will call when she can. Nothing. I called a month later and same issue. Was told to wait for her call. I ask for an email so I can at least just update her on what's happening (court date etc.) Was told "she doesn't give her email out." (Big red flag) I call back this month basically begging for some guidance or help, updated her receptionist on what was happening. I finally get a call back from her receptionist, not Elsia, Being told that "Elsia doesn't remember you or anything regarding your situation." Was told to ask for another court date till I find a lawyer. When the main reason i went to them is because we couldnt afford a lawyer. "We don't have any lawyer available or any help we can give you."... 2 weeks before my court date. I'm sure they have been helpful for some people, but they only were helpful for one week for me. I'm sure I'm not the only one.

I'm sure I'm not the only one.

originalText.text:
Pa'Lante Harlem has not only helped our tenant association fight back, but they have also been instrumental in transforming our community. Their unwavering commitment to empowering residents like us has created a sense of unity and strength within our building. Through their tireless efforts, they have equipped us with the necessary knowledge and resources to effectively advocate for our rights and demand better living conditions.

The impact of Pa'Lante Harlem extends far beyond individual buildings. They have fostered a spirit of collaboration among neighboring buildings in our community, amplifying our collective voices and making our concerns impossible to ignore. Their dedication to creating humane living conditions is evident in the tangible improvements we have witnessed firsthand.

Furthermore, Pa'Lante Harlem's initiatives for homeless prevention have been life-changing for many individuals and families in our building and community. By providing legal support, resources, and compassionate guidance, they have helped countless people avoid the devastating experience of homelessness.

We are immensely grateful for the passion and expertise demonstrated by every member of the organization. Their commitment to justice and equality is not just words but is exemplified through their actions. Pa'Lante Harlem truly embodies the spirit of community, and we feel privileged to have them as our allies.

It is our sincere hope that more individuals and institutions recognize the invaluable work being done by Pa'Lante Harlem and provide them with the support they deserve. Together, we can continue to create positive change and ensure a brighter future for all residents in our community.

originalText.text: One of the nation's best non profits.. Keeping New York; New York..that's what Palante does and has been doing for a long time. When it comes to tenants rights and people who fight for tenants tooth and nail. You can put Palante on top of the list. Aside from tenants advocacy they now provide community food pantry . Come in get the help you need and get some food..palante is definitely moving  the community forward
